item.title: Bond Selloff Seen as Entry Opportunity
item.description: The recent bond selloff suggests the Fed’s June meeting is a “live” one—with the decision open on whether the Fed will raise rates or not, ING said, describing this as an entry opportunity.

item.title: Sterling Could Rise if UK Underlying Price Pressures Persist
item.description: Data on Wednesday are expected to show a sharp fall in U.K. headline inflation in April due to lower energy prices but are unlikely to ease fears over underlying price pressures and that could support sterling, MUFG Bank said.

item.title: Oil Falls With US Debt Talks Eyed
item.description: Oil prices slipped for a third trading day as U.S. debt ceiling talks remained in focus.

item.title: Metals Slip Amid Macroeconomic Woes
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were falling, pressured by weak demand in China and worries over the global economy.

item.title: Greek Conservatives Trounce Opponents in Elections, Buoyed by Economic Upturn
item.description: Greece’s governing center-right came first in national elections, as voters rewarded Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis for recent economic performance.

item.title: Nikkei Closes at 33-Year High, Led by Broad-Based Gains
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average rose 0.9% to 31086.82, its highest closing level since July 1990, reversing its losses earlier in the session.

item.title: Ryanair Swings to Profit as Revenue Beats Views
item.description: Ryanair reported a full-year revenue of €10.8 billion, and said it expects to deliver a modest on-year profit increase in fiscal 2024.

item.title: UK House Prices Jump to Record High in May
item.description: The average house price in the U.K. rose 1.8% in May to reach a new record high, and appears to be a delayed response to the higher-than-expected levels of market activity since the start of the year.

item.title: China Makes Clear Its Military Isn't Funny Anymore
item.description: The fallout from Li Haoshi’s riff on a military slogan is spreading and threatening a broader chill on Chinese arts and culture.

item.title: Universal's "Fast X" took first place at the domestic box office with a debut of $67.5 million, a strong start for the 10th installment of the long-running action franchise.
item.description: Universal’s “Fast X” took first place at the domestic box office with a debut of $67.5 million, a strong start for the 10th installment of the long-running action franchise.

item.title: Your Next Big Move Should Scare You
item.description: Your gut says no. Here’s why you shouldn’t always listen to it.

item.title: A flood of claims for a now-expired pandemic-era tax break for small businesses is straining an IRS caught between pressure to process refunds quickly and the need to identify illegitimate requests.
item.description: A flood of claims for a now-expired pandemic-era tax break for small businesses is straining an IRS caught between pressure to process refunds quickly and the need to identify illegitimate requests.

item.title: China banned major Chinese firms from buying from U.S.-based Micron Technology, saying its products pose a major national-security risk.
item.description: China banned major Chinese firms from buying from U.S.-based Micron Technology, saying its products pose a major national-security risk.

item.title: Exxon joined the hunt for lithium with the recent purchase of drilling rights in a tract of land in Alabama, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Exxon joined the hunt for lithium with the recent purchase of drilling rights in a tract of land in Alabama, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: The availability of new cars and trucks on dealership lots is bouncing back this spring selling season, and for some brands is stronger than expected.
item.description: The availability of new cars and trucks on dealership lots is bouncing back this spring selling season, and for some brands is stronger than expected.

item.title: Kashkari said he could support holding interest rates steady at the Fed's next meeting to give officials more time to assess the effects of past rate increases and the inflation outlook.
item.description: Kashkari said he could support holding interest rates steady at the Fed’s next meeting to give officials more time to assess the effects of past rate increases and the inflation outlook.

item.title: Kyiv's forces have lost effective control of the eastern city of Bakhmut, Ukraine's top commander in the region said, as Moscow declared its first significant conquest since last summer after months of relentless fighting that has cost thousands of lives and obliterated the city.
item.description: Kyiv’s forces have lost effective control of the eastern city of Bakhmut, Ukraine’s top commander in the region said, as Moscow declared its first significant conquest since last summer after months of relentless fighting that has cost thousands of lives and obliterated the city.

item.title: China is increasing efforts to develop a satellite-powered internet network that can compete with Elon Musk's Starlink, whose military applications have been displayed in Ukraine's defense against Russia.
item.description: China is increasing efforts to develop a satellite-powered internet network that can compete with Elon Musk’s Starlink, whose military applications have been displayed in Ukraine’s defense against Russia.

item.title: Biden said he expected a thaw in relations with China, a day after he and other Group of Seven leaders took steps to tackle what they see as Beijing's economic intimidation.
item.description: Biden said he expected a thaw in relations with China, a day after he and other Group of Seven leaders took steps to tackle what they see as Beijing’s economic intimidation.

item.title: The NAACP issued a travel advisory for Florida to warn potential tourists of state laws and policies that the group sees as hostile to LGBT people and people of color.
item.description: The NAACP issued a travel advisory for Florida to warn potential tourists of state laws and policies that the group sees as hostile to LGBT people and people of color.
